text: @PaperMario15 I agree with your comment. Seems like most gaming websites prefer SMG 2 but I prefer the first one. author: Wilbum Noburn

text:
@oscarnswe Easier to decide than you'd think.

Galaxy 1 was a huge step forward for Mario in terms of both gameplay and music.
Galaxy 2 was a mishmash of recycled content with a few lousy new features.

Take your pick.

text: If you think about it, the original mario games were all linear.  When the series went to 3D (mario 64) it suddenly became non-linear.
author: Solar Powered

text: I have to disagree, I believe this song is one of the best.  I think it's the melancholy violin  that mixes with the marching drum so well.
author: Solar Powered

text: What I meant by linear (and don't take that as a bad thing, because it certainly isn't), is that the paths you need to take to get to the different stars are handed to you. You are forced to take that certain path to get to that certain star. Except for the secret stars of course. And this is why M64 didn't feel as linear.
author: SupraDarky

text:
no, he just wanted the game to be a refreshing change of pace from the usual platforming games.  

i dont think this one is any more linear than SM64 though.
